availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: At County Court for the County of Clinton began and held at the Court house in Albany on Monday the 4th day of April 1864.

Present, Hon. Abijah Guthrie Presiding Judge It Ordered that the following named persons be and they are hereby recommended to the Governor as suitable persons for Justices of the peace for Clinton County viz:

for the first District T. C. Ashinhurst and P. H. Hopkins, for the second District W. W. Davis, and W. B. Perdue, for the third District J C Staten and C. P. Talbott, For the Fourth District John H. Wright and J. H. Tompkins For the Fifth District James H. Wood and Abner Beaty.

A copy attest: C. P. Gray D. C.
for H. M. Hurt Clk

Order of Clinton Court
J. P
Comd
A Copy
20th Apl/64
T. E. Bramlette
Gov & c
